org.usgs.manifold.packet

Class DefaultHeader

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.usgs.manifold.packet.DefaultHeader

  • public class DefaultHeader
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines a starting delimeter as well as standard header information that should always appear in every packet. 
     
 Definition:
 messageType   1 byte  unsigned byte
 stationNumber 2 bytes unsigned short

    • Constructor Detail

      • DefaultHeader

        public DefaultHeader(org.jboss.netty.buffer.ChannelBuffer frame)
              throws org.jboss.netty.handler.codec.frame.CorruptedFrameException
        Reads the header information from the given ChannelBuffer. This method modifies the ChannelBuffers reader index.
        Parameters:
        frame - the ChannelBuffer that contains the required header information at the current reader index.
        Throws:
        org.jboss.netty.handler.codec.frame.CorruptedFrameException - if there are not enough bytes in the ChannelBuffer.

    • Method Detail

        Returns:
        the message type of the packet.

        public int getStationNumber()
        Returns:
        the serial number of the packet.

      • getDelimeter

        public static org.jboss.netty.buffer.ChannelBuffer getDelimeter()
        Returns:
        the start of packet delimeter.

      • checkDelimeter

        public static void checkDelimeter(org.jboss.netty.buffer.ChannelBuffer frame)
                           throws org.jboss.netty.handler.codec.frame.CorruptedFrameException
        Compare the starting delimeter to the start of frame to see if it has the right starting delimeter. This modifies the frame by removing the number of bytes expected to be in the delimiter.
        Parameters:
        frame - the ChannelBuffer that contains the ending delimeter.
        Throws:
        org.jboss.netty.handler.codec.frame.CorruptedFrameException - if the ChannelBuffer does not match.
